Lebanon’s foremost sportsman and climber

MAXIME CHAYA

at IC!

Tuesday, June 16, 2015 at 11:20 am

G&R Irani Auditorium

Maxime Chaya- Lebanese Hero

Lebanon’s foremost sportsman and climber, Maxime Chaya was the first person from his home country to hoist its flag atop Everest.

He did so at the climax of his challenge to ascend the highest mountain on every continent – the Seven Summits – while also skiing to the North and South Poles.

After his homeland’s civil war resulted in a multi-cultural Lebanese, French, Greek and Canadian education, Max graduated with honours from the London School of Economics, and today he regularly visits schools, universities and clubs to help motivate youngsters to ‘climb their own Everest'.

Knighted twice for his achievements, Max lives on the Mediterranean coast, just north of his native Beirut, with his children Edgard and Kelly.

‘There is an Everest for Everyone’

Maxime Chaya has stretched the limits of motivation, determination and perseverance further than anyone else in the region can claim to have done. Through meticulous preparation, rigorous training, and exemplary discipline, he has accomplished a tremendous feat few adventurers in the world have ever dreamed of.

Max has dreamt, imagined, planned and lived his dream of climbing the Seven Summits, accomplishing it in a flawless manner, few if any thought possible. Now that he has climbed the Seven Summits, skied to both Poles, and successfully carried-out numerous fascinating expeditions to the four corners of the world, Maxime is back to share the experience and some of the valuable lessons he has learned. Everyday lessons that are applicable to our everyday lives be it at work, at home, or anywhere in-between.

Max’s passionate lectures shed light on his dream, plan and motivation as well as his drive, determination and focus to persevere and break through mental barriers while not forgetting to tolerate change in the aim of reaching the goal. In his presentation, he draws on exclusive footage as well as images from his library of breathtaking photographs, to tell us about the extraordinary four-year journey he undertook. His journey to the top- the very top - of the world.

Major international sporting achievements

• 2nd overall: “Trophée du Nil” (Egypt – 1998)

• 3rd overall: “Raid Thai” (Thailand – 1999)

• 1st place: “Kenya Sports Safari” (Kenya – 2001)

• 23rd: UCI World Masters Championships (Canada - 2001)

• One of the 1st Lebanese 'Ironman' triathletes (Holland - 2002)

• 4 times winner of the Redbull Sno-to-Sea (Lebanon – 2003 to 2006)

Climbed peaks, and reached landmarks

• Mont Blanc (France)

• Cho Oyo (Tibet / Nepal)

• Mount Aspiring (New Zealand)

• The Geographical North Pole (the Arctic Circle)

• The South Pole (Antarctica)

• Mount Ama Dablam (Nepal)

• The Matterhorn (Switzerland / Italy)
